<a id="InstancePlaceholder"></a>

# InstancePlaceholder

**Inherits:** [Node](Node.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

Placeholder for the root [Node](Node.md) of a [PackedScene](PackedScene.md).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

Turning on the option **Load As Placeholder** for an instantiated scene in the editor causes it to be replaced by an **InstancePlaceholder** when running the game, this will not replace the node in the editor. This makes it possible to delay actually loading the scene until calling [create_instance()](InstancePlaceholder.md#InstancePlaceholder_method_create_instance). This is useful to avoid loading large scenes all at once by loading parts of it selectively.

\ **Note:** Like [Node](Node.md), **InstancePlaceholder** does not have a transform. This causes any child nodes to be positioned relatively to the [Viewport](Viewport.md) origin, rather than their parent as displayed in the editor. Replacing the placeholder with a scene with a transform will transform children relatively to their parent again.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="InstancePlaceholder_method_create_instance"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Node](Node.md) **create_instance**\ (\ replace\: [bool](bool.md) = false, custom_scene\: [PackedScene](PackedScene.md) = null\ ) [ðŸ”—](#InstancePlaceholder_method_create_instance)

Call this method to actually load in the node. The created node will be placed as a sibling *above* the **InstancePlaceholder** in the scene tree. The [Node](Node.md)'s reference is also returned for convenience.

\ **Note:** [create_instance()](InstancePlaceholder.md#InstancePlaceholder_method_create_instance) is not thread-safe. Use [Object.call_deferred()](Object.md#Object_method_call_deferred) if calling from a thread.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InstancePlaceholder_method_get_instance_path"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](String.md) **get_instance_path**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#InstancePlaceholder_method_get_instance_path)

Gets the path to the [PackedScene](PackedScene.md) resource file that is loaded by default when calling [create_instance()](InstancePlaceholder.md#InstancePlaceholder_method_create_instance). Not thread-safe. Use [Object.call_deferred()](Object.md#Object_method_call_deferred) if calling from a thread.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="InstancePlaceholder_method_get_stored_values"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Dictionary](Dictionary.md) **get_stored_values**\ (\ with_order\: [bool](bool.md) = false\ ) [ðŸ”—](#InstancePlaceholder_method_get_stored_values)

Returns the list of properties that will be applied to the node when [create_instance()](InstancePlaceholder.md#InstancePlaceholder_method_create_instance) is called.

If `with_order` is ``true``, a key named ``.order`` (note the leading period) is added to the dictionary. This ``.order`` key is an [Array](Array.md) of [String](String.md) property names specifying the order in which properties will be applied (with index 0 being the first).
